intro: Sparattanthelium hirtum, commonly known as the hairy spathanthelium, is a rare grass species native to specific regions of South America. It is characterized by its dense, hairy foliage and compact growth habit, which helps it thrive in its natural habitat. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Its botanical structure includes narrow, grass-like leaves and a fibrous root system adapted to nutrient-poor soils. Due to its limited distribution and unique morphology, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
